key_risks: Regulatory and compliance risks, including potential fines and legal actions due to non-compliance with HIPAA and billing practices
High debt levels with a debt-to-equity ratio of 2.2, which could strain financial flexibility
Reimbursement pressures from government and private payors, impacting profitability
Operational risks due to reliance on physician partnerships and maintaining high patient volumes
controversies: $41 million settlement in 2020 for allegations of defrauding federal health programs through unnecessary urine drug testing services
Past legal disputes and allegations of fraudulent billing practices raising ethical concerns
social_issues: Potential impact on patient care quality and privacy due to regulatory and compliance risks
governance_issues: Ethical and legal concerns stemming from past settlements and legal disputes, raising questions about governance standards
